intro: Englerastrum hjalmarii, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic regions of Europe and Asia. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that grows in rocky and barren habitats. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds. Englerastrum hjalmarii plays a role in stabilizing soil in its harsh environment and supports local pollinators.
